entry.title: Getting started with the Microsoft-Windows-Threat-Intelligence ETW Provider

link.title: Getting started with the Microsoft-Windows-Threat-Intelligence ETW Provider

entry.summary: TL;DR The Microsoft-Windows-Threat-Intelligence ETW Provider is a very powerful tool to detect many kill chain attacks such as memory injection and others. In this blog, I will show a way to take advantage of this provider, consume its events logs and ship them to ELK stack. Before jumping to the technical steps, let’s talk a little bit about the Threat Intelligence ETW(Event Tracing for Win...

entry.title: Setting up an automated Red Team Infrastructure (REDCELL)

link.title: Setting up an automated Red Team Infrastructure (REDCELL)

entry.summary: Redcell is an Infrastructure as Code Lab of red teamers operations , it’s built using Vagrant and Ansible , and it can be deployed and run locally . This lab is made of six virtual machines that seems necessary for the Cyber Kill Chain steps : scanVM running kali-Linux machine with needed tools like Nmap , dirsearch , … crackVM running Ubuntu machine with Hashcat tool install...

entry.title: Setting up an Nginx Redirector for covenant C2

link.title: Setting up an Nginx Redirector for covenant C2

entry.summary: What is covenanat C2 ? Covenant is a .NET command and control framework and web application that aims to highlight the attack surface of .NET, make the use of offensive .NET tradecraft easier, and serve as a collaborative command and control (C2) platform for red teamers. Covenant is an ASP.NET Core, cross-platform application that includes a web-based interface that allows for multi-user co...
